data.title: Halsey Dermatology
data.text:
Dr. Mark Halsey, MD is a double board-certified dermatologist practicing general, cosmetic, and pediatric dermatology on the South Fork. Dr. Halsey received his undergraduate degree in Mathematics from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. He graduated from the University of South Florida College of Medicine, where he was a member of the Alpha Omega Alpha medical honor society, and served as president of his medical school class.

Dr. Halsey completed his internship at the world-renowned Massachusetts General Hospital (Harvard Medical School), followed by dermatology residency at the University of Massachusetts, where he served as Chief Resident in his final year. He then completed additional training in pediatric dermatology at Boston Children's Hospital (Harvard Medical School, Dept. of Dermatology) to obtain a second board certification in pediatric dermatology. He completed the American Society of Dermatologic Surgery Preceptorship program to gain additional expertise in cosmetic dermatology, and minimally invasive procedures of the skin.

He holds a faculty appointment at the Ronald O. Perelman Department of Dermatology at NYU, where he has taught residents and medical students as an Assistant Clinical Professor of Dermatology since 2016, and previously held a training appointment at Harvard Medical School.

Dr. Halsey is a Diplomate of the American Board of Dermatology, with dual board certifications in Dermatology and Pediatric Dermatology. He is a Fellow of the American Academy of Dermatology and the American Society for Dermatologic Surgery, and a member of the Society for Pediatric Dermatology.

His practice interests are in procedural, cosmetic, pediatric, and general dermatology. He maintains a clinically focused and patient-centered practice. He has multiple publications in peer-reviewed research journals, and currently serves as a reviewer for the Journal of the American Academy of Dermatology.

Mark Halsey has deep ties to the south fork, with family living in the Hamptons for the past 13 generations. He lives in Water Mill, with his wife, June, and his 3 children.

Ashton Wilson, MSPAS, PA-C is a board-certified New York-licensed Physician Assistant specializing in medical and cosmetic dermatology. She received her Masters Degree from Pace Universityâs PA program, receiving clinical training at many of NYCâs top medical centers including NYU Langone Health, Lenox Hill Hospital and Maimonides Medical Center.

Ashton is a Diplomate Fellow with the Society of Dermatology Physician Assistants, qualified to evaluate and treat a wide range of skin conditions for patients of varying ages, cultural backgrounds, and skin types. She is a member of the Society of Dermatology Physician Assistants, New York State Society of Physician Assistants, as well as the American Academy of Physician Assistants.

Ashton attended the University of Florida on fully paid presidential merit-based scholarship, graduating with her Bachelorâs degree in Health Sciences, with minor degrees in both Health Disparities in Society and Public Health. Born and raised in the panhandle of Florida, Ashton is well-versed in the long-term effects of sun exposure and strongly believes in the power of prevention and patient education regarding sun protection and skin cancer screenings.

Aimee Drexel is a licensed esthetician, with advanced certification in laser hair removal. She completed the esthetics program at New York Institute of Beauty in Islandia, NY followed by additional training at Berkowits School in Forest Hills, NY. She is a member of the Associated Skin Care Professionals and is always looking to further advance her knowledge and skills through continuing education.

Aimee is a local to the East End. She provides beauty and makeup product expertise, and helps advise patients on skincare routines. In addition to providing facial and esthetic treatments, she serves as our cosmetic patient concierge and liaison, enhancing the experience of patients receiving cosmetic treatments in our office.

We do not accept insurance as payment in full for plans in which we do not participate.

Prior to your appointment, please call our office or speak to your insurance company to determine if our practice participates with your particular plan. We do not participate with "health share" plans or other non-insurance entities, but patients may still see us using our self-pay rates, with payment due at time of service.

For those whose plans require a referral to see a specialist, it is each patient's responsibility to request a referral from their primary care physician in advance to ensure coverage for the visit.
